format_1_state_log.event_description: Patient Arthur Vance is nearing Day 20 of his post-CABG stay; the SNF Social Worker, Brenda, is aggressively pushing for a Friday discharge to avoid the Managed Medicare co-pay 'cliff' for the facility's metrics, despite the patient's sternal wound showing serosanguinous drainage.
format_1_state_log.ai_assumed_bottleneck: Social Worker Brenda is intentionally withholding the 'face-to-face' clinical notes from the PN to prevent the PN from flagging the wound as a reason to delay the discharge until the following week.

format_1_state_log.event_description: The PN was not notified of Mr. Vance's admission until Day 14, creating a 'Black Hole' scenario where the family's anxiety regarding home care has fermented without professional navigation.
format_1_state_log.ai_assumed_bottleneck: The facility's admissions coordinator delayed the referral to the PN hub to allow their internal 'preferred' HHA first-right-of-refusal, which was eventually declined due to staffing shortages.

format_1_state_log.event_description: Managed Medicare Advantage plan requires an updated physician certification for the vacuum-assisted closure (VAC) therapy prior to home transition, but the surgeon is currently in a 3-day surgical block.
format_1_state_log.ai_assumed_bottleneck: The surgical group's front office refuses to route the PN's inquiry to the Physician Assistant, insisting that only the Surgeon can sign the 'face-to-face' documentation for the Advantage plan.

format_2_triples.situation: Social Worker Brenda is 'ghosting' the PN's emails regarding the final Home Health Agency (HHA) selection to ensure her preferred vendor gets the referral.
format_2_triples.action_taken: Physically intercepted Brenda during her morning walk-to-rounds and provided a pre-printed 'Patient Choice' form signed by the daughter.
format_2_triples.tactical_field_intent: Force a public acknowledgment of the patient's preference in front of the Nursing Director to neutralize Brenda's steering tactics.

format_2_triples.situation: The patient's daughter is hostile, accusing the PN of 'working for the insurance company' to kick her father out of the SNF early.
format_2_triples.action_taken: Conducted a side-by-side review of the SNF's physical therapy progress notes with the daughter, contrasting them with the home-care clinical requirements.
format_2_triples.tactical_field_intent: Pivot the daughter's anger toward the facility's discharge timeline by positioning the PN as the 'safety auditor' who will only allow discharge once the home team is fully briefed.

format_2_triples.situation: The SNF Medical Director is ready to sign the discharge order, but the 'face-to-face' encounter for the home wound care is missing from the chart.
format_2_triples.action_taken: Identified the Surgeon's Nurse Practitioner in the facility parking lot and secured a verbal confirmation of the home care plan to be transcribed immediately.
format_2_triples.tactical_field_intent: Bypass the hospital's bureaucratic records department by leveraging a 'parking lot' encounter to ensure the clinical narrative matches the HHA's authorization needs.

format_3_rl_scenario.description: Respect the Social Worker's established discharge timeline and wait for the facility to provide the final clinical packet before contacting the home health team.
format_3_rl_scenario.rationale: This maintains institutional harmony by not challenging the SW's authority, but it risks a 'missed discharge' if the HHA doesn't receive the paperwork until after the patient is already home.

format_3_rl_scenario.description: Schedule a three-way conference call between the PN, the HHA Intake Coordinator, and the Patient's Daughter to verify that the home care start-of-care time aligns with the facility's Friday transport schedule.
format_3_rl_scenario.rationale: This proactively addresses 'Schedule De-conflict' issues and ensures the family feels supported without overstepping the facility's clinical discharge authority.

format_3_rl_scenario.description: Advise the patient's daughter to refuse the transport vehicle on Friday morning, citing 'unstable wound drainage,' until the PN can personally verify the HHA has the VAC supplies in hand.
format_3_rl_scenario.rationale: While this ensures patient safety, it is a significant overstep because a non-clinical PN is coaching a family to ignore a physician's discharge order and interfering with the facility's bed management.

narrative_summary: 75-year-old Arthur Vance is being fast-tracked for discharge after a cardiac bypass to satisfy the SNF's financial metrics before his Medicare Advantage co-pay triggers. The case is complicated by a 'Black Hole' delay in PN assignment and a burned-out Social Worker who is steering the referral to an overburdened HHA. The PN must navigate a hostile family dynamic and a missing 'face-to-face' clinical document to ensure a safe transition that includes specialized wound care for a sternal VAC.
